text: [Music]
once upon a time there was a king whose
Little Kingdom was as big as his eyes
could see and he loved it very much the
king had one daughter and he wanted her
to marry a man wise and clever who would
someday become a good King to his people
so he got it announced in his kingdom
and all the kingdoms around that
whosoever wishes to marry the princess
must fulfill two conditions one he must
bring to the king a collection of the
finest pearls ever seen and two he must
fulfill some special tasks the king will
set for him soon noble men sons princes
merchants sons came in great numbers to
the palace
most of them brought a collection of the
finest pearls you have ever seen but
none of them could fulfill any of the
tasks the King set for them they were
all made to return without as much as
looking at the process soon the number
of potential suitors dwindled and the
King began to worry such a wide world
and not one good suitor for our daughter
all of them either pompous or silly or
Blasi what is to become of our daughter
and our kingdom after we are gone
don't worry my dear there must be
someone in this world who will be clever
enough to do the tasks we lay for him it
so happened that near the seat in this
kingdom there lived a fisherman with his
two sons Paul and Jesper Paul was the
older one lazy and arrogant while Jesper
was clever hardworking and kind Oh wake
up you still haven't got out of bed and
see Jesper has already laid the fishing
lines and got the boat ready father if
you think I am lazy and useless why do
you ask me to do anything
let Jesper do it that day the fisherman
had great luck his net caught twenty
Auster's and when he opened them he
found to his great astonishment that
each of the oysters contained a pearl as
dazzling as the stars of the night they
surely were the finest pearls in the
whole world
he went home and showed the pearls to
his sons twenty Burroughs as sparkling
as the Stars
[Music]
father now that we have pearls why don't
we try to go to the palace and see if we
can win the heart of the princess
I shall divide the pearls equally among
you and then first Paul and then Jasper
you go and try so Paul set out with his
pearls the next morning he walked in the
forest when suddenly he heard a voice
leave will you help us Paul looked
around and then saw a little ant
crawling up his hand no over here on
your arm can you please help us the
beakers are forcefully trying to usurp
our home we must defend it but we need
help or else we shall be vanquished help
us please we might be helpful to you
someday what help can aunt be to a man
off you go
I have better things to do than waste my
time on your petty squabbles and Paul
went on his way a little while later
hello young man what are you carrying
about you so carefully I am carrying
cinders do you want some it so be it
don't you have some bread I feel so
hungry and wherever you are going you
are sure to be served lunch there I told
you all I carry is cinders now off you
go I have more important things to do
than chat up with nosy old women Paul
reached the palace and showed the pearls
to the king and his jewelers
your highness I have never seen a
brighter pearls in my life
they do look exquisite but what is this
what is happening the Pels
just tend to cinders you would bring
fake pearls before the king how dare you
young man I am disappointed that a man
like you lives in my kingdom and
breathes its air now go away from here
and never show me your face again go
away before I put you in the dungeons
forever Paul ran away from the palace as
fast as he could he reached home and
plunked himself in bed it was clear to
the fisherman and Jasper that Paul had
not succeeded Jasper looks like it is
now your turn to try so the next morning
Jesper set out towards the palace on his
way as he traveled in the forest he
heard a voice and you please others who
is this whose voice is it that I hear
look here on your arm I am the king of
the ants the beetles have come to take
away our home in which we have lived for
years and we are battling with them to
defend it but yesterday we suffered so
many losses that we will not be able to
defeat them without help please will you
help us taking away someone's home is
not Brian of course I shall help you
take me to the beetle King
Oh king of the beetles as you can see my
size is much bigger than yours and so is
my strength in one ramming of my boot I
can take out half your army now the king
of ants is my friend and what you were
doing to him and his people is wrong so
do you want me to use my boot or will
you leave the ants alone and never ever
hurt them again me Brahmi is to leave
the ants alone your highness the King
events I stay in that hut by the sea if
the beetles ever trouble you again just
send someone to my home and I shall
protect you I promise that will not be
necessary
cause is betit thank you so much for
your help
no problem after all nobody should be
allowed to treat anyone unfairly as a
token of our appreciation for your help
great KeSPA I give you my solemn word
that whenever you need my help all you
need to do is call and King and I and my
people will appear we can reach anywhere
from wherever thank you your highness I
shall always remember that Jasper went
on his way and a little while later he
met the old woman hello young man hello
my lady
quite a nice day isn't it what is it
that you carry about you so carefully oh
those are pearls for the king I am on my
way to the palace to meet him and
see if I can win the heart of the
princess giving the King pearls is fine
but getting through the tasks do you
have some bread on you I am rather
hungry and you shall be offered a grand
meal at the palace certainly the city is
not far please help yourself have a nice
day take this in return for your
kindness
take this whistle it may not look like
much right now but when you blow into it
anything you desire will be returned to
you is quite an extraordinary gift my
lady
thank you soon Jasper reached the palace
and presented the pearls to the king the
jewelers and the courtiers were
delighted I have never seen pearls like
these before with every passing moment
their luster seems to only increase your
highness yes they are marvelous where
did you get them from young man my
father caught the oysters in the fishing
net sire yes your net is your father
than a fisherman oh yes your highness he
is a fisherman he feeds this kingdom
with the fish he catches my father works
hard and I am proud of him indeed young
man your father is doing great work very
well rest now and tomorrow we shall
begin your death so the next day the
king called for Jasper and took him to a
granary where there lay a huge mound of
mixed grain as you can see five types of
grain have been mixed up in this pile if
you can separate it all out into five
mounds
the hour before sunset you shall move on
to your next task tomorrow but if even
one grain is in the wrong pile you shall
have to go home as you say sire I shall
do my best so the King had Jasper locked
in the granary
so that no help would reach him and left
him alone to complete the impossible
task
Jasper tried for an hour had he soon
realized that the task was too tedious
for him to complete within the allotted
time what do I do
each grain is smaller than an ant and I
have to pick wait a minute the ant the
king of ants he said I could call on him
whenever I needed help well now is the
time
your highness the king of ants Here I am
friend Jamie what can we do for you you
came I told you we would come wherever
whenever
Jasper told the king of ants everything
about the impossible task why don't you
go over in that corner and rest my
people and I will finish the job in no
time so the ant king and his people
finished the sorting of the grain into
five neat mounds such that when the king
came at the appointed hour he was
shocked to see that not only had Jasper
finished his allotted task but also had
spare time to take a nap Jasper how did
you separate all the brain you have
indeed done well but tomorrow you shall
have yet another task the next day the
king called Jasper out into a meadow
Jasper I have had my huntsman catch a
hundred hare
only for this test you will have to look
after them they will graze in the meadow
the whole day and in the evening an hour
before sundown you must return to the
palace with all of them even if one hair
is missing
you shall have failed the task and you
will have to go home I shall do my best
your highness Jasper knew the task was
impossible who could control a hundred
hair who could run anywhere in the
meadow or the forest beyond and why
would they return to Jesper when they
got their freedom from the Kings cages
as soon as they were released the hare
ran in all directions and not one of
them could be seen anymore
Jesper had all but lost the task when he
put his hands in his pocket as was his
habit and there he found the whistle the
old woman in the forest had given him he
blew into it and all the hair returned
to him at once so when it was time to go
to the palace
using his whistle Jesper was able to
return with all hundred hair they are a
hundred hair soil don't believe this you
indeed are clever you have achieved
impossible tasks Bravo
actually sire I have not truly passed
the test on my own I had help hours not
possible
Jesper told the king everything about
the help from the ant king and from the
whistle given to him by the old woman in
the forest you see Sir I had help I did
not clear the tests on my own well to me
you did win the test son for you got
help only in return for your wisdom and
kindness you will make a fine ruler for
my kingdom but as the princess want to
marry me sire yes you are wise kind and
clever man Jasper I would marry you and
so Jesper and the princess were married
with great celebration and they lived
happily ever after
[Music]
